question:
In context with the Kartarpur corridor project, the Nanakpanthi culture has been highlighted. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Nanakpanthis follow only Sikhism.
  2. Nanankpanthis are only in India.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Nanakpanthi is any follower of Guru Nanak and believes his teachings. This is irrespective of religion. This is also because the core philosophy of Guru Nanak is oneness that transcends religion. It has been highlighted in light of Kartarpur corridor project allowing only Sikh pilgrims. Statement 2 is incorrect: Nanakpanthi or Nanank Naam Lewas are found in several countries apart from India. Guru Nanak, in the 15th and 16th centuries travelled far and wide to interact with various cultural groups. He travelled and shared ideas with Afghanistan, Sri Lanka, Tibet, Bangladesh, Saudi Arabia, etc.
